item.title: Emotional identification
item.description: Broadly speaking, we experience three different kinds of emotions in our brains: reactive, routine, and reflective emotions. Reactive emotions are primitive, hardwired, and innate emotions, such as fear and defensive rage, produced in response to a perceived threat.
